publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1076# Tricia Marwick: MS Awareness Week-That the Parliament pays tribute to the work carried out by the Multiple Sclerosis Society in helping thousands of people with multiple sclerosis across Scotland; welcomes MS Awareness Week, 18 to 25 April 2004, as an ideal opportunity to raise awareness of a condition that affects over 10,000 people in Scotland; recognises that there remain serious shortcomings in treatment and support for multiple sclerosis in Scotland, and believes that the Scottish Executive should develop a national standard of care for people with multiple sclerosis to ensure that levels of treatment and support are the same regardless of where in Scotland they live.
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Mark Ballard*, Donald Gorrie*, Robin Harper*, Bruce Crawford*, Des McNulty*, Shiona Baird*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Murray Tosh*, Brian Adam*, Mr David Davidson*, Frances Curran*, Alex Neil*, David Mundell*, Ms Sandra White*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Eleanor Scott*, Stewart Stevenson*, Carolyn Leckie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Jeremy Purvis*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Pauline McNeill*, John Swinburne*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Richard Lochhead*, Jackie Baillie*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mike Pringle*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) John Scott*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Elaine Smith*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Chris Ballance*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Robert Brown*, Shona Robison*

S2M-1076# Tricia Marwick: MS Awareness Week-That the Parliament pays tribute to the work carried out by the Multiple Sclerosis Society in helping thousands of people with multiple sclerosis across Scotland; welcomes MS Awareness Week, 18 to 25 April 2004, as an ideal opportunity to raise awareness of a condition that affects over 10,000 people in Scotland; recognises that there remain serious shortcomings in treatment and support for multiple sclerosis in Scotland, and believes that the Scottish Executive should develop a national standard of care for people with multiple sclerosis to ensure that levels of treatment and support are the same regardless of where in Scotland they live. Supported by: Mark Ballard, Donald Gorrie, Robin Harper, Bruce Crawford, Des McNulty, Shiona Baird, Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Murray Tosh, Brian Adam, Mr David Davidson, Frances Curran, Alex Neil, David Mundell, Ms Sandra White, Christine Grahame, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Eleanor Scott, Stewart Stevenson, Carolyn Leckie, Tommy Sheridan, Jeremy Purvis, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Pauline McNeill, John Swinburne, Richard Lochhead, Jackie Baillie, Roseanna Cunningham, Mike Pringle, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Fiona Hyslop, John Scott, Elaine Smith, Dr Jean Turner, Linda Fabiani, Chris Ballance, Mrs Nanette Milne, Robert Brown, Shona Robison, Jim Mather*, Mr Bruce McFee*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Janis Hughes*, Margo MacDonald*, John Farquhar Munro*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Maureen Macmillan*, Trish Godman*
S2M-1076# MS Awareness Week (lodged on 19 March 2004) Mary Scanlon*
